Class LabelInfo

Namespace
FlowGraph.Core.Models
Assembly
FlowGraph.Core.dll

Provides enhanced label positioning for edges with anchor points and offsets.

public sealed record LabelInfo : IEquatable<LabelInfo>
Inheritance
object
LabelInfo
Implements
IEquatable<LabelInfo>
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)

Examples

// Simple centered label
var label = new LabelInfo("Connection");

// Label near the start with offset
var startLabel = new LabelInfo("Out", LabelAnchor.Start, OffsetY: -15);

// Label near the end, shifted right
var endLabel = new LabelInfo("In", LabelAnchor.End, OffsetX: 10);

// Use with edge definition
var edge = new EdgeDefinition
{
    Id = "e1",
    Source = "node1",
    Target = "node2",
    SourcePort = "out",
    TargetPort = "in",
    LabelInfo = new LabelInfo("Yes", LabelAnchor.Start, OffsetY: -10)
};

Remarks

LabelInfo extends the basic Label string by adding precise positioning control. When both Label and LabelInfo are present, LabelInfo takes precedence.

This design allows backward compatibility with existing code that uses the simple Label property while enabling advanced positioning for new scenarios.

Constructors

LabelInfo(string, LabelAnchor, double, double, double)

Creates a new label info with the specified text and positioning.

public LabelInfo(string text, LabelAnchor anchor = LabelAnchor.Center, double offsetX = 0, double offsetY = 0, double perpOffset = 0)

Parameters

text string

The label text.

anchor LabelAnchor

Where along the edge to position the label. Defaults to center.

offsetX double

Horizontal offset from anchor point. Defaults to 0.

offsetY double

Vertical offset from anchor point. Defaults to 0.

perpOffset double

Perpendicular offset from edge path. Positive = right of edge direction. Defaults to 0.

Properties

Anchor

Where along the edge to anchor the label.

public LabelAnchor Anchor { get; init; }

Property Value

LabelAnchor

Remarks

  • Start: ~25% along the edge path
  • Center: ~50% along the edge path (default)
  • End: ~75% along the edge path

OffsetX

Horizontal offset in pixels from the anchor point. Positive values move right.

public double OffsetX { get; init; }

Property Value

double

OffsetY

Vertical offset in pixels from the anchor point. Positive values move down.

public double OffsetY { get; init; }

Property Value

double

PerpendicularOffset

Perpendicular offset from the edge path, in pixels. Positive values offset to the "right" of the edge direction (as viewed from source to target). Negative values offset to the "left" of the edge direction.

public double PerpendicularOffset { get; init; }

Property Value

double

Examples

// Label 10px to the right of a horizontal edge (appears below)
var rightLabel = new LabelInfo("0.85", perpOffset: 10);

// Label 10px to the left of the edge (appears above)
var leftLabel = new LabelInfo("0.65", perpOffset: -10);

Remarks

This offset is applied perpendicular to the edge direction at the anchor point, similar to GoJS's segmentOffset behavior. The offset rotates with the edge, so a positive value always moves the label to the right side of the edge when viewed from source to target.

Use this to separate labels on adjacent parallel edges or to consistently position labels on one side of edges regardless of their direction.

Text

The text content of the label.

public string Text { get; init; }

string
